solution_description: Accurately estimate market size, identify client-specific sales opportunities, and strategically allocate sales goals across regions, products, and customer segments.

modules.title: Market Overview
modules.description: Interactive market analysis dashboard displaying premiums, policies, agents, wallet share, and demographic data at national, state, and zip code levels. Users can filter by year, product, metric, and state to identify growth opportunities and compare company vs total market figures. Geographic heatmap visualization highlights high and low market potential areas, with detailed zip code tables showing top-performing regions by premium, policy count, agent count, population, and average household income.
capabilities: Display total market size including premium, policy count, and agent count
Compare company data against total market KPIs
View wallet share for premium, policies, and agents
Analyze demographic data including household income and total population
Filter results by year, product type, metric type, and state
Visualize market potential using color-coded geographic maps
Drill down to state or zip code level for detailed performance metrics
Identify top zips by premium, policies, agents, population, and household income
Spot high-value growth territories using heatmap and ranking tables

modules.title: Wallet Share Assessment
modules.description: Interactive dashboard that compares company sales performance against total market sales at zipcode and territory levels, calculating premium share and policy share as indicators of customer penetration. Users can toggle between Premium Share and Policy Share views, filter by year, product, and territory, and explore geographic map visualizations highlighting areas of high or low wallet share. Drill-down tables display detailed company premiums, market premiums, and calculated percentage shares, enabling identification of upsell and cross-sell opportunities within specific regions.
capabilities: Toggle between Premium Share and Policy Share metrics
Display company sales (premium and policies) vs market totals
Calculate share percentage for premium and policy metrics at each geography level
Filter results by year, product, and territory
View wallet share distribution using a geographic heatmap
Drill down to zip code-level tables for detailed comparison
Identify high wallet share areas indicating strong penetration
Spot low wallet share areas for targeted upsell or cross-sell campaigns
Analyze territory-level premium and policy share trends

modules.title: Sales Opportunity
modules.description: Geospatial and tabular dashboard that identifies and ranks potential sales opportunities by territory, state, or zip code. Displays key metrics including company sales, incremental sales opportunity, total sales opportunity, incremental opportunity percentage, and recruiting opportunity. Users can toggle between Map View and Table View, filter by year, product, territory, and state, and select map metrics such as Company Sales, Incremental Sales Opportunity, Total Sales Opportunity, or Total Recruiting Opportunity. The heatmap highlights high and low potential areas, and drill-down tables provide detailed opportunity statistics for targeted sales planning.
capabilities: View potential sales by geography using heatmapped maps
Toggle between Map View and Table View representations
Filter results by year, product, territory, and state
Select map metrics: Company Sales, Incremental Sales Opportunity, Total Sales Opportunity, Total Recruiting Opportunity
Drill down into zip code-level detail to view sales opportunity KPIs
Rank regions by incremental opportunity percentage for targeted selling
Identify recruiting needs based on geographic opportunity data
Compare current company sales to total potential market sales
Highlight high-value opportunity zones for resource allocation

modules.title: Agent Performance
modules.description: Interactive dashboard for evaluating agent recruitment effectiveness and productivity by territory, state, or zip code. Displays key metrics including total life agents in market, company agents, company active agents, agent share, active agent ratio, premium per agent, applications per agent, and premium per application. Offers both Map View and Table View to visualize geographic distribution, with a selectable set of map metrics such as Company Agents, Life Agents in Market, Company Active Agent Ratio, Premium Per Agent, and Premium Per Application. Filters allow narrowing data by year, territory, and state, while color-coded geographic heatmaps highlight high and low performance areas for recruitment or productivity improvement.
capabilities: View agent counts and productivity KPIs at national, state, or zip code level
Switch between Map View and Table View modes
Select map metrics: Company Agents, Life Agents in Market, Company Active Agent Ratio, Premium Per Agent, Premium Per Application
Filter results by year, territory, and state
Analyze company agent share and active agent ratios
Identify high-performing and low-performing agent regions via heatmaps
Drill down to individual zip code performance metrics
Assess premium per agent and per application
Support recruitment planning by identifying opportunity zones

modules.title: Intelligent Goal Setter
modules.description: Advanced dashboard to set, assign, and adjust sales goals and expense allowances across territories, products, and customer size segments. Displays aggregated KPIs including Current Sales, Sales Goal, Sales Increment, Sales Increment Percentage, and Sales Target. Provides detailed territory and country-level breakdowns showing performance by country manager, incremental sales needed to meet goals, and product-specific targets (Universal Life, Whole Life, Term Life, Indexed Universal Life, Variable Universal Life). Enables planners to model different company-wide targets, assess goal gaps, and optimize allocations for both individual territories and overall sales strategy.
capabilities: Display overall current sales, sales goal, sales increment, and increment percentage
Adjust company-wide sales target dynamically
View territory and country-level goal assignments with assigned country managers
Break down goals and current sales by product line
Identify sales gaps and incremental opportunities to meet targets
Filter results by industry, region, or product category
Support quota allocation planning by geography and product mix
Analyze performance at territory and product levels for optimization
Model adjustments to targets for different growth scenarios

modules.title: Sales Funnel
modules.description: Pipeline visualization and performance analysis dashboard showing each stage of the sales process from contact list through policies placed post free look period, with counts, percentages, and revenue impacts. The '3 Months Cumulative Funnel View' tracks stage-to-stage conversion (Leads, Qualified Leads, Applications Started, Applications Received, Applications Submitted, Policies Issued, Policies Placed), while the 'Sales Assessment' view quantifies monetary impacts from leads, applications, placement rate, and premium per policy against planned target, highlighting gaps in sales performance. This tool helps identify bottlenecks, measure conversion efficiency, and assess the financial implications of sales funnel performance.
capabilities: Monitor pipeline stages from lead generation to policy placement post free look period
View stage-level metrics including counts and percentage of leads retained
Analyze gross sales YTD actual vs target, and identify over/under performance gap
Break down sales assessment by Leads Impact, Apps Impact, Placement Rate Impact, Premium/Policy Impact
Track conversion rates between stages to identify bottlenecks
Quantify financial impact of each sales stage relative to plan
Visualize funnel counts and conversion percentages over a 3-month cumulative period
Assess sales gap size and contributing factors via bar chart analysis
Use to evaluate marketing effectiveness and optimize sales resources

modules.title: Territory Design
modules.description: Interactive territory planning dashboard for designing and optimizing sales territories based on market potential and population metrics. Displays geographic boundary maps with color-coded territories and allows filtering by year, product type, state, territory, and Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA). Provides views for Original, Transition, and New Territory configurations. The dashboard lists Relevant Market Size and Relevant Population for each territory, with drill-down into rep-level data showing individual market contributions and population coverage. Supports comparative analysis to balance workloads, maximize market penetration, and guide staffing recommendations.
capabilities: Display geographic maps with color-coded territory boundaries
Filter territories by year, product type, state, specific territory, and MSA
Switch between Original, Transition, and New Territory views
View Relevant Market Size and Relevant Population for each territory
Drill down into territory data for individual sales representatives
Rank territories by total market size or population
Identify territories with highest and lowest market potential
Support workload balancing by comparing rep-level market sizes
Assess impact of territory changes on overall market coverage

modules.title: Territory Design Tool
modules.description: Dynamic, interactive territory visualization and scenario modeling tool that allows users to create, edit, and compare regional sales configurations. A geographic heatmap displays territories with metrics such as Market Premium, Client Premium, Premium Share, Market Agents, Client Agents, Agent Share, Market Policies, Client Policies, Policy Share, Avg Household Income, Total Sales Opportunity, and Incremental Sales Growth. Provides functionality to add new regions, adjust territory boundaries, and save or delete custom scenarios with defined region groupings. Summary metrics update in real time to reflect selected scenarios, helping assess market potential, sales allocation, and growth impact.
capabilities: Display interactive geographic map of territories with color-coded metrics
Select map metric—options include Market Premium, Client Premium, Agent Share, Policy Share, etc.
View real-time summary metrics for selected territories
Add, edit, or remove territory regions
Create custom territory scenarios with defined regional groupings
Save scenarios for future use or delete outdated scenarios
Compare different scenario configurations (e.g., 6-region vs 8-region view)
Assess impact of territory design changes on market potential and incremental growth
Filter or highlight regions to focus on key markets

modules.title: Broker Score Card
modules.description: Comprehensive broker analytics dashboard providing detailed KPIs on sponsorship, policies, product mix, premium history, persistency, and renewal performance at multiple levels. Includes filters for broker name, territory, and product line. Displays key metrics such as Sponsor Count, Policy Count, Products per Policy, F/M Premium, Renewal Premium, Prerenewal Premium, Renewal Rate, Pre-Renewal Rate, and Rate Change %. Visualizations include RTFM vs A/E Ratio scatter plot, RTFM History trend chart, Product per Sponsor distribution, Package Persistency, and Renewal Premium breakdowns by Product, Size, Industry, and Territory. Supports drilling down into renewal subsets to identify broker-specific strengths, weaknesses, and market opportunities.
capabilities: Filter broker KPIs by broker name, territory, and product line
View total inforce sponsor, policy count, and products per policy
Analyze financial metrics: F/M Premium, Renewal Premium, Prerenewal Premium, Renewal Rate, Pre-Renewal Rate, Rate Change %
Visualize RTFM vs A/E Ratio scatter plot for performance distribution
Track RTFM history over multiple years
Display product mix via Product per Sponsor chart (Life, LTD, STD, Dental, Vision, Other)
Compare benefit persistency vs premium persistency over time
Break down renewal premium by product category
Analyze renewal premium by customer size segment
Review renewal premium by industry sector
Examine renewal premium by defined territory
Identify brokers with high or low persistency and renewal performance
Support data-driven decisions for broker retention strategies

modules.title: InsurIQ
modules.description: Property & Casualty performance dashboard providing a side-by-side comparison of company data vs market benchmarks. Displays detailed premium, loss, expense, and underwriting profitability metrics segmented by state, line of business (LOB), and year. The Summary view features Direct Premium Earned (DPE), Losses Incurred, Loss Adjustment Expense (LAE), Commissions, General Admin Expense, Other Expenses, Combined Expenses, and Underwriting Profit/Loss, alongside market values and computed market share. Also provides Operating Ratios such as Loss & LAE Ratio, Commissions Ratio, Admin Expense Ratio, Other Expenses Ratio, and Combined Ratio with basis point differences versus market averages. Interactive slicers and additional tabs allow deeper analysis of Market Share, Loss Ratio, Commissions, and Combined Ratio trends.
capabilities: Filter metrics by State, Line of Business (LOB), and Year
Compare company values to market data for all key P&C metrics
View detailed breakdown of premium, loss, commissions, admin expenses, and other expenses
Analyze market share across multiple metrics
Track underwriting profit or loss trends
Review operating ratios and basis point differences from market benchmarks
Navigate to specialized tabs for Market Share, Loss Ratio, Commissions, and Combined Ratio
Identify performance gaps versus market averages
Utilize NAIC-sourced industry benchmarking

solution_description: Utilize pattern recognition algorithms to prioritize applications or work volumes, maximizing yield rates, optimizing workflow, and reducing unit costs.

modules.title: Work Inventory
modules.description: Comprehensive case-level inventory dashboard tracking applications across multiple dimensions including demographics, financials, product type, status, underwriting details, and risk assessment. Displays sortable table columns such as Case ID, Submit Date, Age, Gender, BMI, State, Income, Tobacco use, Application Type, Product, Face Amount, Broker, Status (Open/Complete), Underwriter, Lead Score, Priority level (High, Normal, Low, DTQ), Assessment (risk categorization), and Client Name. Enables filtering by case attributes, product type, geography, and priority to track work volumes, monitor case progression, and assess risk levels. Supports workflow management by highlighting high-priority cases for immediate action and identifying bottlenecks in processing.
capabilities: Display full case inventory with sortable and filterable columns
Filter cases by product type, geography, broker, underwriter, and risk category
View detailed applicant demographic and financial data
Monitor case status (Open/Complete) for workflow tracking
Highlight and prioritize cases based on lead score and priority label
Review underwriting assignments and broker relationships
Assess risk using the Assessment column with categories such as Declined, Low Risk, Medium Risk
Track face amounts and product types for portfolio balance analysis
Identify bottlenecks by monitoring cases in specific workflow stages

modules.title: Score Calculator
modules.description: Interactive tool for generating real-time case scores based on detailed customer and application attributes, with automatic classification into priority levels (DTQ, Low Priority, Normal Priority, High Priority). Users can input data including age, height, weight, gender, alcohol consumption, nicotine use, state, application type, product type, broker, received month, annual income, and face amount. Displays resulting case score alongside priority category, and visualizes factor impacts using a Percentile Contribution Chart. Supports scenario adjustments by modifying any attribute, allowing scoring weight analysis and export of results for integration with case databases.
capabilities: Enter detailed case attributes for scoring
Generate case score instantly based on sales propensity
Automatically classify case into DTQ, Low, Normal, or High Priority ranges
Visualize factor contributions in a Percentile Contribution Chart
Modify attribute values to test score sensitivity and impact
Export scoring results for external tracking or reporting
Integrate score output with case databases
Support strategic prioritization of cases based on calculated score

modules.title: Attribute Analysis
modules.description: Analytical dashboard for evaluating average lead scores and performance metrics across multiple case attributes, including broker, state, age, income, product type, and face amount. Provides summary KPIs such as total cases, sold cases, closing ratio, average lead score, total premium, and forecast premium. Visualizations show top-performing brokers and states by average lead score, age and income brackets linked to lead score performance, and product/face amount contributions to lead scoring. Interactive filters for application type and underwriter enable targeted attribute analysis, helping identify key drivers of performance and conversion trends across industries and product lines.
capabilities: Display top brokers ranked by average lead score
Display top states ranked by average lead score
Analyze lead score by age bracket
Evaluate lead score by income range
View product types ranked by average lead score
Break down face amount ranges by lead score performance
Filter results by application type and underwriter
Compare total premium vs forecast premium
Assess closing ratio across selected attributes
Identify key performance drivers influencing lead score and conversion rates

modules.title: Priority Bin Dashboard
modules.description: Interactive pipeline and priority segmentation dashboard that categorizes applications into priority bins (High Priority, Normal, Low, DTQ) and tracks case counts, premiums, and conversion metrics for each bin. Displays key KPIs including total cases, sold count, % sold, total premium, and expected premium. Visualizations include application mix by priority bin, total premium by bin, expected premium by bin, average case score by bin, and expected sold ratio by bin, with pipeline averages highlighted for comparison. Users can filter by product, application type, underwriter, broker, state, and income bin to evaluate performance drivers and prioritize sales activities for the most promising cases.
capabilities: Categorize applications into High Priority, Normal, Low, and DTQ bins
Track case counts per priority bin
View total and expected premium by priority category
Analyze average case score for each bin vs pipeline average
Compare expected sold ratio to pipeline average
Filter results by product, application type, underwriter, broker, state, and income bin
Identify opportunities in high priority bins for targeted follow-up
Assess sales potential and conversion likelihood by priority category
Visualize pipeline distribution for workload balancing and targeting

modules.title: Score Distribution
modules.description: Analytical dashboard for exploring case score distributions and their relationship to sales conversion performance. Includes key metrics such as total cases, sold cases, closing ratio, total premium, and average lead score. Provides breakdowns by priority action (High Priority, Normal, Low, DTQ) with case counts, sold cases, case percentage, sold case percentage, and closing ratio. Visualizations include percentage of cases by sold indicator vs case score, cumulative case percentage by sold indicator, histogram showing score frequency with sold vs not sold overlay, and case mix by score illustrating sold proportion across score ranges. Filters allow segmentation by product, application type, underwriter, age bin, income bin, and state to identify outliers, performance trends, and optimal scoring ranges.
capabilities: View overall case score distribution and overlay of sold vs not sold cases
Analyze cumulative case percentage by sold indicator across score ranges
Break down case mix by score to see conversion proportion
Compare metrics across priority bins (High, Normal, Low, DTQ)
Filter cases by product, application type, underwriter, age bin, income bin, and state
Identify optimal scoring ranges for highest closing ratios
Detect outlier scores and investigate their conversion outcomes
Track changes in distribution when applying segmentation filters
Support data-driven case prioritization based on scoring trends

solution_description: Efficiently assign risk ratings to prospective life customers purchasing transactional term products by leveraging minimally invasive customer and external data.

modules.title: Engine
modules.description: Interactive underwriting engine tool for calculating real-time risk recommendations and ratings based on comprehensive customer attributes. Users input case data including age, height, weight, gender, exercise habits, smoking habits, genetic family medical history, motor vehicle violation record, and systolic/diastolic blood pressure. The system calculates a rating percentage and assigns a risk category ranging from Sub Standard to Super Preferred, reflecting the propensity of the case to be preferred. A dynamic Percentile Contribution Chart visualizes the impact of each attribute on the overall risk rating. Supports scenario adjustments to see how changing inputs alters outcomes, and results can be exported for record-keeping.
capabilities: Enter detailed customer attributes for underwriting analysis
Calculate real-time risk rating and recommended underwriting class
Classify cases into categories: Sub Standard, Standard, Standard Plus, Preferred, Super Preferred
View percentile contribution chart for attribute impact visualization
Assess influence of lifestyle habits and medical history on rating
Adjust inputs to model different risk scenarios
Export results for external review or historical tracking

modules.title: Underwriting Engine Framework
modules.description: Visual framework illustrating the data flow and algorithm logic used to generate underwriting risk ratings. Inputs include a wide range of non-invasive applicant attributes such as demographics (age, gender, height, weight), lifestyle factors (exercise, activity, tobacco use, alcohol use), financial indicators (income, net worth, credit), product details (product type, face amount), personal and family health history, motor vehicle violation records (MVR), inspection, and Rx search data. These inputs feed into the UW Engine analytic module, producing a Risk Assessment Rating ranging from Substandard to Super Preferred. The output table provides calculated logistic values, odds ratios, model fit probabilities, and final ratings per case ID. A comparison-to-actual chart visually depicts how predicted risk class aligns with real-world outcomes.
capabilities: Display the end-to-end underwriting engine data flow
Illustrate non-invasive applicant attributes considered by the model
Show algorithm outputs including logistic values, odds ratios, probabilities, and risk ratings
Rank cases by predicted underwriting class
Compare predicted ratings against actual classifications using visual charts
Highlight key factors impacting movement between rating categories
Support transparency in model-based underwriting decisions

modules.title: Performance Metrics
modules.description: Comprehensive set of visualizations and probability distribution analyses for evaluating UW Engine model accuracy against actual underwriting decisions. Includes model training data output, testing data validation, and cross-validation outputs for multiple variable configurations. Each chart shows the model's estimated probability that a case is in a preferred underwriting class (Y = 1), segmented by likelihood ranges (<10%, 10-25%, 25-50%, 50-75%, 75-90%, 90%+). Key metrics highlight false negatives (low likelihood predicted but actually preferred) and false positives (high likelihood predicted but actually standard/substandard) with associated percentages. Cross-validation views display performance using reduced variable sets (e.g., 8-variable model, 6-variable model) with breakdowns by demographic and risk history attributes. Supports model refinement and validation by revealing classification trends, prediction accuracy, and misclassification rates across probability ranges.
capabilities: View probability distribution across likelihood segments for preferred classification
Compare model predictions to actual underwriting decisions
Analyze false positives and false negatives with percentage breakdowns
Review training data output vs testing data validation results
Evaluate cross-validation performance using different variable sets
Highlight attribute importance in reduced variable models
Identify prediction accuracy trends across varying likelihood ranges
Support model optimization through misclassification analysis

modules.title: Submission Ingestion
modules.description: Automated email ingestion system for underwriters that extracts key submission data fields from inbound emails and attachments, presenting them in a clean, tabular format for review and action. Fields such as Submission Date, Inception Date, Industry, Currency, Revenue, Region, Underwriter Name, Broker Name, and Insured Name are parsed directly from message bodies, signatures, and contextual content. Integrated auto-reply functionality can notify brokers or carriers if any required data fields are missing, or confirm when all required data fields have been received and the query is in process. This tool accelerates underwriting workflows by standardizing data collection from varied unstructured email inputs.
capabilities: Parse inbound submission emails and attachments to extract predefined data fields
Identify and fill required fields including dates, industry, currency, revenue, region, underwriter, broker, and insured details
Display parsed submission details in a sortable, editable table format
Send automated responses to brokers/carriers specifying missing or complete data fields
Integrate with UW tools for rapid case initiation
Enable editing or correction of extracted fields before workflow continuation
Support consistent data formatting for underwriting evaluation

components.title: UW Manager
components.description: Interface for managing extraction column definitions, data field descriptions, and priority levels for incoming email submissions. Underwriters can select active fields, set high/medium/low extraction priorities, and define parsing rules, including contextual inference (e.g., infer currency from symbols or codes) and hierarchical data extraction (e.g., broker from email signature). Ensures system extracts all required fields with quality and consistency.
capabilities: Select which extracted fields are active in ingestion output
Assign priority (High/Medium/Low) for each column
Define detailed descriptions for extraction logic per field
Use contextual rules to infer missing values (currency, broker name, insured name)
Ensure data completeness before auto-reply is triggered
Maintain standardized field configuration across underwriting team

components.title: UW Inbox
components.description: Inbox-style interface displaying extracted submissions from received emails with all parsed fields visible in a tabular layout. Each entry includes metadata such as sender, subject, submission date, inception date, industry, currency, revenue, region, underwriter name, broker name, and insured name. Allows quick review, editing, and processing of cases directly from the list view, with attachment and email context accessible on demand.
capabilities: Display parsed submissions in a sortable and filterable table
Show full metadata for each received email submission
Allow inline editing of extracted fields
Link directly to original email and attachments
Provide easy navigation between submissions for batch processing
Support quick transition from email ingestion to underwriting analysis

solution_description: Enhance profitability by applying targeted renewal actions informed by historical sales and claims experience data.

modules.title: Renewals Estimator / RTM Estimator / RTF Estimator
modules.description: Industry-specific analytics dashboard for calculating and adjusting renewal rates at the sponsor (policyholder) level. For Employee Benefits, the tool uses Renewals to Manual (RTM) methodology; for Commercial Lines – P&C, it uses Renewals to Formula (RTF) methodology. RTM/RTF compares the previous year's renewal, pre-renewal, and benchmark premium amounts against actual and historical performance to provide recommended rate adjustments. Displays active policyholder profile data—industry category, territory, tenure, size index, product portfolio, coverages, and renewal month—as well as historical loss experience including 5-year expected loss, incurred loss, premium, expected loss ratio (LR), actual LR, incurred-but-not-reported ratio (IBNR), and A/E ratio. Visual tools include RTM/RTF vs 5-year LR scatter plots, scenario vs recommended premium comparisons, and term rate sensitivity views. Supports scenario modeling, premium forecasting, and targeted renewal strategies using either manual or formula benchmarks depending on industry.
capabilities: Display active policyholder profile and core underwriting metrics
For Employee Benefits: calculate and benchmark using Renewals to Manual (RTM)
For Commercial Lines – P&C: calculate and benchmark using Renewals to Formula (RTF)
View historical 5-year loss experience including IBNR and A/E ratios
Compare renewal, pre-renewal, and benchmark premiums against RTM or RTF values
Adjust scenario actions to see effects on implied RTM/RTF and premium values
Compare scenario vs recommended premiums side-by-side
Analyze RTM/RTF vs 5-year LR scatter plots for historical performance context
Evaluate term rate sensitivities at scenario and suggested action levels
Support targeted bundling and renewal strategies aligned to industry-specific benchmarks

modules.title: Target List / Target Sponsor List / Target Policy Holder List
modules.description: Industry-specific targeting dashboard to identify accounts with persistently unprofitable renewal histories for precise, data-driven renewal actions. For Employee Benefits, the tool is presented as the 'Target Sponsor List', listing sponsors with details such as policy effective date, industry category, employee lives, state, territory, broker, and in-force product basket (products currently active). For Commercial Lines – P&C, it is presented as the 'Target Policy Holder List', listing policy holders with similar attributes including company size and product basket. The lists support setting thresholds to determine inclusion criteria and provide comparison views for 'Target vs All' accounts. Designed to prioritize renewal actions toward accounts needing rate adjustments, coverage changes, or targeted bundling based on profitability and strategic fit.
capabilities: List accounts flagged for prioritized renewal action based on profitability criteria
For Employee Benefits: display sponsor details including employee lives, broker, product basket, and territory
For Commercial Lines – P&C: display policy holder details including company size, broker, product basket, and territory
Filter target lists by thresholds such as size, industry category, and territory
Use 'Target vs All' comparison to contextualize performance of selected accounts
Identify opportunities for rate adjustments, coverage changes, and product bundling
Provide quick access to broker and product portfolio information for each account

modules.title: Renewals Dashboard
modules.description: Comprehensive renewal performance dashboard with industry-specific benchmarking. For Employee Benefits, displays the Policy RTM (Renewals to Manual) Distribution; for Commercial Lines – P&C, displays the Policy RTF (Renewals to Formula) Distribution. Summarizes in-force renewal data across market segments, including policies, gross written premium (GWP) values for pre-renewal, renewal, and benchmark (manual or formula), lapse rates, pre-RTM/pre-RTF values, RTM/RTF values, rate increase percentages, premiums, expected claims, incurred claims, loss ratio, and either the A/E ratio (Employee Benefits) or IBNR ratio (Commercial Lines). Provides filtering by market segment, size/lives bin, SIC industry category, and territory. Visualizations include histograms showing policy distribution by RTM/RTF bins, cumulative policy count lines, and bar charts showing percentage of policies and renewal premium by aggregate action bin. Enables underwriters to identify renewal segments needing rate adjustments and to analyze renewal outcomes against industry benchmark methodologies.
capabilities: Filter renewal data by market segment, lives/size bin, SIC industry category, and territory
Summarize renewal KPIs including lapse rates, premiums, claims, loss ratio, and benchmark ratios
For Employee Benefits: calculate and display Renewals to Manual (RTM) values with A/E ratio
For Commercial Lines – P&C: calculate and display Renewals to Formula (RTF) values with IBNR ratio
Display histograms of policy count by RTM/RTF bin and cumulative policy count
Show percentage split of policies and renewal premium by aggregate action bin (<0.9, [0.9, 1), (1, 1.1], >1.1)
Provide context for each RTM/RTF bin including GWP, claims, and loss ratios
Enable identification of renewal segments above or below benchmark thresholds for targeted rate actions

modules.title: Pricing & Economics
modules.description: Pricing and profitability analysis dashboard for evaluating the impact of renewal rate changes against the formula benchmark in Commercial Lines – P&C. Provides model price sensitivity plots comparing price sensitivity values against 2-year sales data to identify optimal pricing actions. Accounts are visually categorized into four strategic action segments: High Demand / High Sensitivity, Low Demand / High Sensitivity, High Demand / Low Sensitivity, and Low Demand / Low Sensitivity. The chart uses a horizontal benchmark sensitivity line (1.00) and vertical sales benchmark to segment accounts for potential renewal adjustments. Enables underwriters and pricing analysts to model how changes in renewal rates can capture additional revenue or margin while maintaining competitive positioning relative to the formula rate.
capabilities: Compare account price sensitivity scores against 2-year sales data
Identify accounts with high demand and high sensitivity for targeted rate increases
Detect accounts with low sensitivity where rate adjustments may be less impactful
Segment accounts visually into four strategic pricing action categories
Use benchmark sensitivity (1.00) and sales thresholds to guide renewal pricing decisions
Evaluate potential revenue and profitability impacts from rate changes compared to the formula rate
Support strategic negotiations with brokers using demand and sensitivity profiling
Model competitive pricing scenarios for Commercial Lines – P&C renewals

solution_description: Optimize commission structures by analyzing contracts and scenarios for both retail and wholesale brokerage.

modules.title: Contract Ingestion
modules.description: AI-assisted ingestion of insurance commission contracts, transforming unstructured documents into clean, structured, ready-to-use data. Accepts electronic or scanned contract files and extracts key contractual details for both Property & Casualty and Employee Benefits contexts. Upon ingestion, displays the parsed output using the same layout as the Contract Summary module, allowing verification immediately after processing. For Property & Casualty, extracted fields include Contract ID, Carrier, Ingestion Date, Year, Program Name, Bonus Type, Threshold Definitions, Bonus Percentages, Effective/Expiration Dates, and Source Document references with notes. For Employee Benefits, extracted fields include Contract ID, Carrier, Ingestion Date, Business Type, Product Type, Compensation Method, Amount, Unit, Qualifier, Payment Frequency, Effective Date, State, Maximum Amount, Maximum Applies To, and Notes (e.g., region-specific growth targets). Enables quick transition from ingestion to analysis, eliminating manual data entry.
capabilities: Upload contract documents in supported formats for ingestion
Apply AI models to parse unstructured PDFs or scanned documents into structured fields
Extract Property & Casualty-specific fields: Contract ID, Program Name, Bonus Type, Thresholds, Bonus %, Dates, Source Document, Notes
Extract Employee Benefits-specific fields: Contract ID, Business Type, Product Type, Compensation Method, Amount/Unit, Unit Qualifier, Payment Frequency, Dates, Max Amount, Max Applies To, Notes
Display ingestion results in tabular form for immediate verification
Filter or search within ingestion results by key field values
Export parsed contract data to CSV for integration into downstream systems

modules.title: Contract Summary
modules.description: Centralized repository of all ingested commission contracts, offering search, filter, and export functionality. Displays structured contract data for both Property & Casualty and Employee Benefits industries. For Property & Casualty, the summary table includes: Contract ID, Carrier, Ingestion Date, Year, Program Name, Bonus Type, Threshold Applied To, Threshold Criteria, Bonus Percentages, Effective Date, Expiration Date, Source Document, and Notes. For Employee Benefits, the table includes: Contract ID, Carrier, Ingestion Date, Business Type, Product Type, Compensation Method, Amount, Unit, Unit Qualifier, Payment Frequency, Effective Date, State, Maximum Amount, Maximum Applies To, and Notes (e.g., regional growth requirements). Provides ability to filter contracts by carrier or other key fields, search text across all columns, and export selected contract data to CSV for external reporting.
capabilities: View all ingested commission contracts in a unified table by industry
Filter contracts by carrier, year, program name, or other attributes
Search text across multiple contract fields
For Property & Casualty: display fields like Contract ID, Program Name, Bonus Type, Thresholds, Bonus %, Dates, Source Document, Notes
For Employee Benefits: display fields like Contract ID, Business Type, Product Type, Compensation Method, Amount & Unit, Payment Frequency, Dates, Max Amount, Max Applies To, Notes
Export filtered contract lists to CSV for offline analysis
Serve as the single source of truth for all commission agreements on file

modules.title: Contract Comparison
modules.description: Side-by-side comparison tool for analyzing two commission contracts, highlighting similarities, differences, and key clauses across core sections. Supports both Property & Casualty (P&C) and Employee Benefits (EB) industries. For P&C, compares commercial lines commission schedules, bonus plans, thresholds, eligibility criteria, variables, caps, payment timing, and inclusions/exclusions. For EB, compares life and supplemental benefit product commission plans including commission rates, renewal/retention requirements, product inclusions/exclusions, caps, effective periods, and special clauses. Differences are summarized in a dedicated 'Key Difference' column for rapid analysis.
capabilities: Display contracts side-by-side by metric/category
Highlight differences between corresponding contract sections
Summarize distinctions in a 'Key Difference' column
Compare P&C commercial line plans including program bonus types, eligibility criteria, rate ranges, caps, eligibility period, and payment terms
Compare EB product lines such as life, LTD, STD, supplemental, and voluntary coverages with details on new and renewal rates, persistency, and caps
Review variables impacting commission (rate tiers, growth factors, multipliers)
Identify effective dates and renewal term differences between contracts
Document inclusions and exclusions for eligible products and coverages
Support compliance and negotiation by surfacing contract discrepancies quickly

modules.title: Commission Tool
modules.description: Agency-level contingent commission management platform that enables property & casualty and employee benefits agencies to adjust, calculate, and optimize commissions across all carriers with full flexibility. For Property & Casualty, users can set loss ratio limits, eligible written premium thresholds, and contingent commission rates for commercial lines to distribute commissions across carriers. Carriers can be ranked by contingent commission percentage or dollar value, with contract database integration providing min/max thresholds and eligible ranges. Includes optimization views that compare current commission mix to a reallocated mix based on premium movement strategies, showing total commission gain, percentage improvement, and estimated impact on enterprise value. For Employee Benefits, the tool calculates contingent commissions for selected benefit products based on current in-force premium, new premium amounts, number of clients, and business type, identifying top carriers by contingent commission earnings. Supports ongoing refinement of commission strategies as new contracts are ingested.
capabilities: Set loss ratio thresholds and eligible written premium ranges for contingent commission distribution (P&C)
View top carriers ranked by contingent commission percentage or dollar value
Access contract database with min/max ranges for loss ratio and premium eligibility
Upload and manage commission contract terms for multiple carriers
Calculate contingent commissions for employee benefit products based on current and new premium amounts
Filter commission calculations by number of clients and business type
Compare current commission mix to optimized mix after reallocation of premium to best-performing carriers
Display total commission values, improvement amounts, improvement percentages, and enterprise value impact
Adjust premium movement scenarios and EBITDA multiples to model financial outcomes
Support iterative refinement of commission strategies as new contracts are ingested

modules.title: Commission Forecasting
modules.description: Interactive forecasting dashboard for projecting commission income at the property & casualty portfolio level, designed to support strategic planning and performance management for agencies and carriers. Provides month-by-month, quarter-by-quarter, and annual summaries with data categories including Actuals, Budget, and 4Qast (forecast projections). Key metrics display variance between Actuals vs Budget, Actuals vs 4Qast, and 4Qast vs Budget with percentage differences color-coded for quick interpretation. Filters allow users to segment by business segment, region, and metric subtype to refine analysis. Includes both summary and comparison views to track performance trends, identify deviations, and adjust commission strategies accordingly.
capabilities: View commission data broken down by year, quarter, and month
Analyze actual commission results against budget targets
Compare actual values against forecast (4Qast) projections
Review forecast values against set budget targets
Interpret variance percentages with color-coded indicators for better insight
Segment forecast and performance data by business segment, region, and metric subtype
Switch between summary and comparison modes to explore different analytical perspectives
Identify periods with underperformance or overperformance to guide commission strategies
Support planning exercises with historical trend and forecast-based adjustments

solution_description: Analyze historical data and apply statistical techniques to predict future results accurately. Identify key trends and variance drivers for proactive decision-making.

modules.title: Leadership Dashboard
modules.description: Executive-level dashboard providing performance metrics for revenue, expenses, and EBITDA across selectable timeframes, regions, products, and profit centers. Includes overall financial KPIs such as Total Revenue, Total Expenses, EBITDA Actual, EBITDA Margin, Core EBITDA Margin, Flow Through %, and Core Revenue Growth %. The Summary view consolidates profitability metrics, revenue metrics, and expense metrics, comparing Actual, Budget, 4Qast (forecast), and Prior year values. Revenue metrics distinguish between contingent and core income streams, while expense metrics break down by category (Compensation, Admin Core, Technology, Occupancy, Selling, Admin Non-Core) with detailed components such as salary, commissions, benefits, bonus, payroll tax, contract labor, and occupancy costs. Designed for top-level variance analysis and comparison over multiple periods and scenarios to support strategic decision-making.
capabilities: View high-level financial KPIs for total revenue, total expenses, EBITDA, EBITDA margin, and growth percentages
Compare Actual, Budget, 4Qast forecast, and Prior year values for profitability metrics
Distinguish revenue streams between contingent and core income
Analyze expense distributions across major categories including Compensation, Admin Core, Technology, Occupancy, Selling, and Admin Non-Core
Drill down into detailed expense components such as salary, commissions, benefits, bonus, payroll taxes, contract labor, and technology costs
Filter dashboard by view type (e.g., YTD cumulative), year, month, region, profit center, and product line
Support variance analysis through Actual vs Budget, Actual vs 4Qast, and Budget vs 4Qast comparisons
Enable leadership teams to monitor operational and financial performance across multiple divisions or business lines
Provide strategic insight for budget adjustments, cost optimization, and growth planning

modules.title: 4Qast Dashboard
modules.description: Forecast analytics dashboard for visualizing and analyzing sales and revenue forecasts across multiple industries, regions, territories, products, segments, and size bins. The Current Forecast view displays month-by-month sales performance metrics for the current year against forecast, last year actuals, and goal targets. Charts show actual vs forecast bars with goal and last year trend lines, plus a difference-from-prior-forecast variance chart to highlight significant changes. Summary panels provide Year-to-Date (YTD) and Full Year (FY) totals for actuals, forecasts, goals, last year performance, and percentage achievements vs targets or prior periods. Variance panels compare values vs prior forecasts and budgets to quantify accuracy and trend improvements. Supports detailed filtering and switching between Current Forecast, Forecast Breakdown, and Rolling Forecast tabs for deeper analysis of drivers influencing forecast behavior.
capabilities: Visualize monthly actual vs forecast sales and revenue
Overlay goal and last year performance trend lines for context
Analyze difference-from-prior-forecast variance to detect changes
View YTD and FY summaries for actuals, forecasts, goals, and last year values
Calculate % achievement vs goal and vs last year
Compare current forecast against prior forecasts to assess accuracy and trends
Filter forecasts by sales region, sales territory, product, segment, and size bin
Switch between Current Forecast, Forecast Breakdown, and Rolling Forecast views
Identify drivers influencing forecast changes using breakdown views
Support cross-industry forecasting with unified analysis framework

modules.title: 4Qast Drill Down
modules.description: Interactive drill-down forecasting view that breaks down the factors influencing forecast performance at a detailed attribute level. The Sales Waterfall chart compares the forecast vs goal, showing category-by-category contributions (positive or negative) that explain variance from targets. Categories can include product lines, segments, size bins, regions, or territories depending on selected filters. Each waterfall step quantifies the revenue impact in monetary terms, enabling users to see how specific products, segments, or markets contributed to variances from the goal and to the year-end forecast total. Supports dynamic filtering and toggling between attribute types to isolate the drivers for changes in forecast behavior.
capabilities: Display a waterfall chart showing forecast vs goal revenue differences
Break down variance contributions by product, segment, size bin, region, or territory
Quantify individual category impacts in monetary terms
Highlight positive and negative revenue drivers relative to forecast goals
Isolate category-level performance to identify areas of strength or weakness
Filter and drill down by multiple attributes to refine analysis
Provide a year-end forecast total after accounting for all category contributions
Support root cause analysis for forecast variance at granular attribute levels
